contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=August 2009}} [[File:Hikawa in Kumamoto Prefecture.png|thumb|250px]] {{Nihongo|'''Yatsushiro District'''|八代郡|Yatsushiro-gun}} is a [[districts of Japan|district]] located in [[Kumamoto Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. As of the [[Yatsushiro, Kumamoto|Yatsushiro]] merger but with 2003 population estimates, the district has an estimated [[population]] of 13,524 and a [[population density|density]] of 406 persons per square kilometer. The total area is 33.29 km². ==Towns and villages== *[[Hikawa, Kumamoto|Hikawa]] ==Mergers== :''See [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan]].'' *On August 1, 2005, the municipalities of [[Izumi, Kumamoto|Izumi]], [[Kagami, Kumamoto|Kagami]], [[Sakamoto, Kumamoto|Sakamoto]], [[Senchō, Kumamoto|Senchō]] and [[Tōyō, Kumamoto|Tōyō]] merged into the [[cities of Japan|city]] of [[Yatsushiro, Kumamoto|Yatsushiro]]. *On October 1, 2005, the towns of [[Miyahara, Kumamoto|Miyahara]] and [[Ryuhoku, Kumamoto|Ryūhoku]] merged to form the new town of [[Hikawa, Kumamoto|Hikawa]]. {{Kumamoto}} {{coord|32|35|05|N|130|40|23|E|type:landmark_source:itwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts in Kumamoto Prefecture]] {{Kumamoto-geo-stub}}
